newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: LG Cable begins aluminium alloy output. [CORRECTED 06:58 GMT]
newsitem.headline: LG Cable begins aluminium alloy output. [CORRECTED 06:58 GMT]

text.p: South Korea's LG Cable and Machinery Ltd, a unit of LG Group, said on Tuesday it has begun production of aluminium alloy for industrial use.
A LG Cable spokesman said the company has invested a total of 50 billion won (Corrects from 500 million won) from 1994 to set up the production line including extrusion facility.
The spokesman said the plant has an annual alloy production capacity of 30,000 tonnes - 15,000 tonnes of extrusion and 15,000 tonnes of aluminium rod.
LG Cable is aiming at turnover of 50 billion won (Corrects from 500 million won) in 1997 and expected it to reach to 200 billion won in 2000.
